modules.description: This module defines a polymorphic variant type `t` representing various PCI ID categories, including class, subclass, vendor, and device identifiers, with operations to convert values to string and compare them. It supports concrete use cases such as identifying and categorizing PCI devices based on their class, vendor, and device IDs, and enabling structured comparisons between different ID types. The `SUBDEVICE_ID` variant specifically captures composite device-subdevice relationships.

This module defines a structured representation of PCI device information, including hierarchical classifications for device types, vendors, and subdevices. It provides operations to organize and access PCI data through typed records and polymorphic variants, enabling precise identification and categorization of hardware components. Concrete use cases include parsing and querying PCI device databases to match hardware based on class, vendor, device, and subdevice IDs.

This module parses and queries PCI device database files, providing access to class, subclass, vendor, device, and subdevice names based on numeric identifiers. It operates on a structured in-memory representation of PCI ID data, using types like `Pci_db_types.Id.t`, `classs`, and `vendor`. Concrete use cases include looking up human-readable device information from raw hardware identifiers and merging multiple PCI databases with custom conflict resolution strategies.
